intro: Byttneria andamensis, commonly known as the Andaman balsa, is a flowering plant native to the Andaman Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, lowland areas. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its distribution in coastal regions.
